titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers, 1979-1983 and undated RL.11591
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-03-30 15:58:43 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Kennedy was an executive and Director of Human Resources. Collection includes correspondence, brochures, research reports and other printed materials. JWT subsidiaries and other firms represented include Brouillard Communications, Hill & Knowlton, Lansdowne, Lord Geller Federico & Einstein, Soskin/Thompson Associates and Thompson Recruitment Advertising. Materials touch on a variety of topics relating to personnel management, including affirmative action, alcohol counseling, career development, compensation, executive succession, professional development, retirement and training. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Correspondence; Subject Files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Kennedy was an executive and Director of Human Resources.
BA, Stanford University, 1959; Account Management, Foote Cone Belding, 1960; Personnel, General Foods, 1966; joined JWT 1979, Director of Human Resources 1980

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1987.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. Alun Jones papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Don Robertson papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Herbert Eames papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Jack Peters papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Jack Stevens papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Joseph O'Donnell papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Peter A. Schweitzer papers;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, brochures, research reports and other printed materials. JWT subsidiaries and other firms represented include Brouillard Communications, Hill & Knowlton, Lansdowne, Lord Geller Federico & Einstein, Soskin/Thompson Associates and Thompson Recruitment Advertising. Materials touch on a variety of topics relating to personnel management, including affirmative action, alcohol counseling, career development, compensation, executive succession, professional development, retirement and training. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
